posts.post_content: Is the bread coupon for a baseball pennant worth getting graded ? It has Johnny Evers on the display on the front . I can’t seem to find much on it other than the couple articles on the internet about the Ferguson Bakery set .

I presume you have the trade card that advertizes the pillow top available for coupons cut from the D381 cards. If so, no need to grade it but it will bring a nice price via auction. I know I'd love to have it, as would others.

No it’s for the pennant. I don’t have my iPad near but it’s white and has the Peerless Bread name with a picture of all the pennants in a circle in the left hand corner and Johnny Evers pennant on right corner . It’s not made of paper I don’t think and has a watermark of Sterling pressed into the material .
Not sure if they would even grade this but why bother? It speaks for itself! I’m interested if you decide to sell….

If what you have matches the item posted by Rob G., then we are all talking about the same thing. Grading is unnecessary. If you wish to sell it, an auction would be your best bet since several of us would like to bid on it.

I think I used to own one of those (not positive) and I too would be interested if you are going to sell it. 
 Don't get it graded. It will increase the value 0. Put it in a good card saver or Ultra Pro top loader and be done with it. 
.
The item that RobG posted is mine. That is my pic. I reached out to him about some postcards . I was just curious about it , I collect pre-war baseball but have never seen one before .
